00020 struct A{
00021         A(){
00022                 std::cout << "A() ";}
00023 
00024         A(const A&){
00025                 std::cout << "A(A) ";}
00026 
00027         ~A(){
00028                 std::cout << "~A() ";}
00029         A& operator = (const A&){
00030                 std::cout << "=(A) ";
00031                 return *this;
00032         }
00033 };
00034 template<typename A, typename II, typename BI>
00035 BI uninit_copy(A& a, II b, II e, BI x){
00036    BI p = x;
00037    try{
00038         while(b!=e){
00039            a.construct(&*x, *b);
00040            ++b;
00041            ++x;}
00042         }
00043    catch(...){
00044       destroyer(a, p, x);
00045       throw;
00046       }
00047    return x;
00048    }
00049 
00050 
00051 template <typename A, typename BI, typename U>
00052 BI uninit_fill(A& a, BI b, BI e, const U& v){
00053         BI p = b;
00054         try{
00055                 while(b!=e){
00056                 a.construct(&*b, v);
00057                 ++b; 
00058                 }
00059         }
00060         catch(...){
00061         destroyer(a, p, b);
00062         throw;
00063         }
00064         return e;
00065 }
00066 
00067 template<typename A, typename BI>
00068 BI destroyer (A& a, BI b, BI e) {
00069         while(b!=e){
00070         --e;
00071         a.destroy(&*e);
00072         }
00073         return b;
00074 }

00092 template <typename T, std::size_t N, typename A = std::allocator<T> >
00093 class Array {
00094     public:
00095         // --------
00096         // typedefs
00097         // --------
00098         typedef A                 allocator_type;
00099         typedef T                 value_type;
00100 
00101         typedef std::size_t       size_type;
00102         typedef std::ptrdiff_t    difference_type;
00103 
00104         typedef value_type*       pointer;
00105         typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
00106 
00107         typedef value_type&       reference;
00108         typedef const value_type& const_reference;
00109 
00110         typedef pointer           iterator;
00111         typedef const_pointer     const_iterator;
00112 
00113     public:
00114         // -----------
00115         // operator ==
00116         // -----------
00117 
00123         friend bool operator == (const Array& lhs, const Array& rhs) {
00124             // you must use std::equal()
00125             return std::equal(lhs.begin(), lhs.end(), rhs.begin() );
00126             }
00127         
00128         // ----------
00129         // operator <
00130         // ----------
00131 
00136         friend bool operator < (const Array& lhs, const Array& rhs) {
00137             // <your code>
00138             // you must use std::lexicographical_compare()
00139             return std::lexicographical_compare(
00140                 lhs.begin(), lhs.end(), rhs.begin(), rhs.end()
00141                 );
00142             }
00143 
00144         // ----------
00145         // operator <<
00146         // ----------
00147 /*
00148         friend std::ostream operator << (std::ostream& os, const Array& rhs){
00149                 for(unsigned int i=0; i<rhs.size(); ++i){
00150                    os << rhs[i] << " ";
00151                         }
00152                 os << std::endl;
00153                 return os;
00154         }
00155 */
00156     private:
00157         allocator_type malc;
00158         char ca [ (sizeof(T) * N) / sizeof(char) ];
00159         //value_type a[N];
00160         pointer a;
00161 
00162     public:
00163         // ------------
00164         // constructors
00165         // ------------
00166         
00171         explicit Array (const_reference v = value_type(), 
00172                         const allocator_type& mlc = allocator_type()) : malc(mlc) {
00173             //std::fill(a, a+N, v);
00174             //uninit_fill(this->malc, a, a+N, v); 
00175             a = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(ca);
00176             uninit_fill(this->malc, a, a+N, v); 
00177             }
00178 
00183         template <typename II>
00184         Array (II b, II e, const allocator_type& mlc = allocator_type()): malc(mlc) {
00185             size_type i = 0;
00186             a = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(ca);
00187             while(b!=e){
00188                 a[i] = *b;
00189                 ++b; ++i;
00190                 }
00191             }
00192         /*
00193          *Copy constructor
00194          */
00195         Array(const Array& that){
00196         malc = that.malc;
00197         a = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(ca);
00198         uninit_copy(malc, that.begin(), that.end(), a);
00199         }
00200         
00201         /*
00202          *Assignment operator
00203          */
00204         Array& operator = (const Array& that){
00205         malc = that.malc;
00206         std::copy(that.begin(), that.end(), a);
00207         return *this;
00208         }
00209         /*
00210          *Destructor
00211          */
00212         ~Array(){
00213            destroyer(this->malc, a, a + N);
00214         }
00215         // -----------
00216         // operator []
00217         // -----------
00218 
00222         reference operator [] (size_type i) {
00223                 reference result = a[i];
00224                 return result;
00225             }
00226 
00230         const_reference operator [] (size_type i) const {
00231             // you must call the non-const operator[]()
00232              const_reference result = const_cast<Array&>(*this).operator[](i);
00233              return result;
00234             }
00235 
00236         // --
00237         // at
00238         // --
00239 
00247         reference at (size_type i) {
00248                 if(i >= N || i < 0){
00249                     throw std::out_of_range("My::Array.at(i) >= size");
00250                         }
00251                 reference result =  a[i];
00252                 return result;
00253             }
00254             
00255 
00263         const_reference at (size_type i) const {
00264                 if(i >= N || i < 0){
00265                     throw std::out_of_range("My::Array.at(i) >= size");
00266                         }
00267                 const_reference result =  const_cast<Array&>(*this).at(i);
00268                 return result;
00269             // you must call the non-const at()
00270             }
00271 
00272         // -----
00273         // begin
00274         // -----
00275 
00279         iterator begin () {
00280             iterator i = a;
00281             return i;
00282             }
00283 
00287         const_iterator begin () const {
00288             // you must call the non-const begin()
00289             const_iterator i = const_cast<Array&>(*this).begin();
00290             return i;
00291             }
00292 
00293         // ---
00294         // end
00295         // ---
00296 
00300         iterator end () {
00301             iterator i = a + N;
00302             return i;
00303             }
00304 
00308         const_iterator end () const {
00309             // you must call the non-const end()
00310             const_iterator i = const_cast<Array&>(*this).end();
00311             return i;
00312             }
00313 
00314         // ----
00315         // size
00316         // ----
00317 
00321         size_type size () const {
00322             return N;
00323             }
00324         
00325         // ----
00326         // print
00327         // ----
00328         void print () const{
00329         for(std::size_t i=0; i<N; ++i){
00330                 std::cout << a[i] << " ";
00331                 }
00332                 std::cout << std::endl;
00333         }
00334 };
